Tapas were fabulous in Spain, but after many a tapas filled day it was nice to try something different.  I believe this is one of many locations in Spain (or at least Barcelona).  Staff was very friendly, lively atmosphere, and although the combinations of ingredients were a little strange to me (maybe more authentic?  not sure but definitely not what I am used to seeing in the US) the ravioli and the pizza we had were delicious.  The highlight for me was the homemade cheesecake - again, different from what I am used to when ordering cheesecake but so delicious.  It was the consistency of yogurt, served in a glass with some berries on the bottom and graham cracker type cookie pieces.  Our waiter spoke English pretty well and the bill for 2 including the pizza, ravioli, cheesecake dessert, and a glass of wine came to only 37 euros.
